questions.question: The state of affairs …………………….. sure to cause her anxiety.
questions.description: Here the subject is the singular noun state.

questions.question: A writer and a speaker ……………………………. in that house.
questions.description: When you connect two singular subjects with and, they become plural and are followed by a plural verb.

questions.question: The introduction of reforms ………………………… greatly opposed by the aristocracy.
questions.description: Here the subject is the singular noun introduction hence we use the singular verb.

questions.question: Time and tide ……………………………. for none.
questions.description: When two singular nouns together express one idea, the following verb is singular.

questions.question: Bread and butter ………………………….. served for breakfast.
questions.description: When two singular nouns together express one idea, the following verb is singular.

questions.question: The horse and carriage ………………………… waiting at the door.
questions.description: When two singular nouns together express one idea, the following verb is singular.

questions.question: Slow and steady ……………………….. the race.
questions.description: When two singular nouns together express one idea, the following verb is singular.

questions.question: …………………………… she know what she is doing?
questions.description: We use does here because the subject is the singular pronoun she.

questions.question: She ……………………………. one project when she started working on the next.
questions.description: We use the past perfect for the earlier of two past actions.

questions.question: I ………………………………. since morning and I was getting tired.
Each man and each woman ………………………. a vote.
questions.description: We use a singular verb after each.

questions.question: Every child …………………………. love.
questions.description: We use a singular verb after each and every.
